titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Hubert Gregory Schenck papers, 1854-1960
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-01-28T12:47-0800

change.item: Declassified records returned to collection (boxes 25-26 and newly created box 29), description of box 28 added, and biographical note written by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Hubert Gregory Schenck Papers)//EN" "schenchg.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 27 manuscript boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 34 envelopes, 20 albums

did.abstract: Correspondence, diaries, speeches and writings, reports, clippings, maps, and photographs relating to the Allied occupation of Japan, relations between Taiwan and the United States, and economic conditions in Japan and Taiwan.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Hubert Gregory Schenck papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1950, with increments received in 1957, 1959, 1977 and 1996.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Memphis, Tennessee
Enlisted in the U.S. Army
Served in the Coast Artillery Corps
Geologic aide, Division of Mines, Philippines
A.B., geology, University of Oregon
M.A., geology, University of Oregon
Married Inga Bergstrom, Berkeley, California
Instructor, field geology course, Stanford
Ph.D., geology, University of California, Berkeley
Appointed to teaching staff as instructor, Stanford University
Assistant professor, Stanford University
Advanced Fellow at the Royal Museum of Natural History of Belgium, Commission for the Relief of Belgium Educational Foundation
Associate professor, Stanford University
Paleontologist in Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan and India, Amiranian Oil Company
Professor of Geology, Stanford University
Commissioned as a major in the U.S. Army, trained for Civil Affairs duties
Served in military government posts in New Guinea, the Philippines, and Japan
Chief, Natural Resources Section, General Headquarters, Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, Japan
Promoted to colonel
Chief, Mutual Security Mission and Economic Cooperation Administration in Taiwan
Returned to Stanford University on a part-time basis
Died, Stanford, California

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, diaries, speeches and writings, reports, clippings, maps, and photographs relating to the Allied occupation of Japan, relations between Taiwan and the United States, and economic conditions in Japan and Taiwan.

controlaccess.corpname: Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers.
controlaccess.subject: Military government.
Technical assistance, American--Asia.

did.unittitle: U.S. Army, Far East Command, General Headquarters, Office of the Engineer, "Report of Reconnaissance of the Coronet Operation,"
37 photos of mineral resources in Japan,
26 photos of mineral resources in Taiwan,
11 photos of a crop collection project and of Japanese farmers belonging to the Omaki agricultural co-op,
3 photos of Mr. Norris E. Dodd, Director General of Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Depicts Dodd arriving in Tokyo, Japan and being greeted by Colonel Sidney L. Huff, General of the Army Douglas MacArthur, and Lt. Colonel H. G. Schenck.

did.unittitle: 2 albums containing 74 photos concerning the Taiwan Ship Building Corporation,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to industrial crops, special products such as silk and cotton, soils survey and irrigation, crop collection and distribution, agricultural education and research, livestock, fertilizers, and fisheries.

did.unittitle: 1 album containing 219 photos concerning Japan's agriculture,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to land reclamation and use, farming methods and equipment, food crop culture, and industrial crop culture.

did.unittitle: 1 album containing 161 photos of Lt. Colonel H. G. Schenck on a Japanese whaling expedition in the Antarctic,
1 album containing 76 photos of damage caused by typhoons Faye and Judith to Japanese farmlands, forests, villages, and towns,
1 album containing 232 photos relating to forestry in Japan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes forest types, lumber production and utilization, flood damage and soil erosion control and forest protection and reforestation.

did.unittitle: 1 album containing 135 photos of the Angaur and Ryukyus regions of Japan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to fisheries, forestry, mining and geology, transportation, and miscellaneous industries. Also incudes photos of Lt. Colonel H. G. Schenck and his staff in Tokyo.

did.unittitle: 1 album containing 155 photos relating to fisheries in Japan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Depicts fishing gear, methods and vessels, marine and special products, aquiculture, fish processing, preparation and distribution, fisheries research, fisheries facilities, and whaling.

did.unittitle: 1 album containing 197 photos relating to mining and geology in Japan, including their mineral resources and solid fuels,
1 album containing 152 photos of oil fields, steel and iron works, chemical industries, and coal mines in Japan,
1 album containing 39 photos of the reconstruction project of pier No. 10, Kaohsiung Harbor, Taiwan, completed April 1952,
1 album containing 36 photos concerning a Taiwan salt factory,
1 album containing 29 photos taken at Tienlun, Taiwan at the time of the inaugural ceremony of the Power Station and 9 photos taken at the Peipu Steam Power Plant,
1 album containing 23 photos of Admiral Radford Party taken at Sun Moon Lake, presented by the Taiwan Power Company,

1 album containing 33 photos of a pictorial review of the interconnection of the Eastern and Western Power Systems, presented to Dr. Hubert G. Schenck, Chief of ECA China Mission, by the Taiwan Power Company,
1 album containing 117 photos of Dr. and Mrs. H. G. Schenck while visiting the Taiwan Power Company,
1 album containing 84 photos of a pictorial account of the Rehabilitation and Development of Telecommunication Service in Taiwan through the aid extended by the MSA under Dr. Schenck's support,
1 album containing 204 photos of the visit of Dr. Hubert G. Schenck and party to the Kaohsiung cement plant in Taiwan,
1 album containing 9 photos of Dr. Hubert G. Schenck, Chief of the MSA China Mission, visiting the Kao-Hsiung ammonium sulfate works in Taiwan,
18 photos of Dr. Hubert G. Schenck's visit to Kao-Hsiung ammonium sulfate works in Taiwan,
30 photos of a duck netting party at the Imperial Hunting Preserve, Japan,
80 photos concerning forestry, lead and gold mines, agricultural land, preparation of fish for the markets, and industry in Korea,
12 photos of ruins in Manila, Philippines,
243 photos of a duck and mist netting party in Japan,
1 album containing 65 photos of the construction of the Hsi-Lo Bridge, Yun-Lin Hsin District, Formosa,
9 photos of the primitive farming techniques used in Japan,
4 photos of Emperor and Empress Hirohito inspecting the NRS exhibit in Tokyo,
12 photos of Emperor and Empress Hirohito as they attend Arbor Day Ceremonies at Ome, Tokyo prefecture, Japan,
16 photos of Lt. Colonel H. G. Schenck and Governor of New York Thomas E. Dewey on a tour of Japan,
8 photos of Colonel Hubert G. Schenck and dignitaries, including Herbert Hoover,

7 photos of Colonel Hubert G. Schenck receiving the order of the Auspicious Star, featuring Ambassador V. K. Wellington Koo, Mrs. Ingrid Schenck Beach, and Major General W. C. Chase, Chief of MAAG (Formosa),
6 photos of Colonel H. G. Schenck in an airplane fight with Mr. Nemoto, Minister of A.G. and F.O.,
4 photos of the Governor of Kumamoto who called on Colonel Schenck to make reports on hydro-electric power projects,
9 photos of General and Mrs. Matthew B. Ridgway and party during a tour of Japan's farming communities,
10 photos of Major General Robert B. McClure as he officiated at inaugural ceremonies in Okinawa,
7 photos of coal mining in Taiwan showing coal washeries, beehive cooking oven, and coal and coke transportation systems,
30 photos of quarantine quarters and docker's living conditions, as well as new housing prepared for the dockers, Taiwan,
13 photos of damaged farmland after a typhoon in Japan,
38 photos of Colonel H. G. Schenck presenting certificates of achievement to visiting consultants to the Natural Resources Section, Tokyo, Japan,
31 photos of Colonel H. G. Schenck, Chief of the Natural Resources Section, inspecting different plants throughout Japan,
127 photos of Mr. H. G. Schenck and Admiral Radford inspecting the Taiwan Power Plant,
173 photos of Colonel H. G. Schenck's travel through Japan,
2 photos of the launch of the Nisshin Maru, a Japanese whaling ship,

12 prints of farewell and return ceremonies of whaling expeditions in Japan, in which Hubert G. Schenck participated as Head of the Natural Resources Section, General Headquarters, Supreme Command for the Allied Powers; 2 prints of an economic mission in Japan,
